docs.title: Equipment Setup
docs.text:
• Two photographers required at all events
  • Primary camera: Full-frame DSLR/mirrorless with 30-150mm zoom lens
  • Secondary camera: Backup body with 24-70mm lens
  • Maintain ISO below 1600 for clean images
  • Shoot in RAW format

docs.title: Composition Rules
docs.text:
• Follow rule of thirds
  • Ensure proper ministry branding in shots
  • Capture candid moments during events
  • Minimum 30% vertical shots for social media

docs.title: Storage Structure
docs.text:
/media/events/
└── YYYY-MM-DD_EventName/
    ├── RAW/
    ├── EDITED/
    └── EXPORT/

docs.title: Naming Conventions
docs.text:
• RAW files: EventDate_PhotogInitials_Seq#.ARW (e.g. 2025-03-08_JDS_001.ARW)
  • Edited files: EventDate_EditVersion_Purpose.extension (e.g. 2025-03-08_v1_Instagram.jpg)

docs.title: Post-Processing
docs.text:
• Use ministry-approved LUTs for color grading:
  • Ministry_WarmTone.cube
  • Ministry_CoolContrast.cube
  • Maintain original RAW files for 3 years

docs.title: Camera Settings
docs.text:
• Shoot in 4K resolution at 24/30fps
  • Maintain 180-degree shutter rule
  • Use ND filters for outdoor shoots

docs.title: Audio Best Practices
docs.text:
• Use lapel mics for speaker recordings
  • Monitor audio levels during events
  • Record room tone for 60 seconds

docs.title: Who are we
docs.text: The Tech Serving Team works behind the scenes, providing the audio-visual support needed to ensure smooth program flow and the success of worship services and special events. We are artists who present with excellence. We value detail and precision. We are the primary and strongest support for everyone on stage.

docs.title: Mission
docs.text: To pursue excellence wherever we serve—using our God-given skills and talents to bless others, honor God, and bring glory to His name.

docs.title: Vision
docs.text: To advance God’s Kingdom by providing excellent technical support for our movement, while intentionally discipling and empowering one another as we serve together.

docs.title: Discipleship
docs.text:
• We grow together to become more like Christ.
  • Give grace freely as we all learn and grow.

docs.title: Excellence
docs.text: • We honor God by giving our very best.

docs.title: Servant Leadership
docs.text:
• We lead with love, not position.
  • We are here to serve, not to impress.
  • Stay humble, stay teachable.

docs.title: Technical Serving Team Guidelines
docs.text:
• Respect the Workspace: Keep the booth clean and organized. No food or beverages allowed. Always practice CLAYGO (Clean As You Go).
  • Take Ownership: Properly set up and pack away all equipment (e.g., computers off, cameras neatly stored).
  • Be Prepared: Study the program details thoroughly and come ready to serve.
  • Dress Appropriately: Wear neat, casual attire (closed footwear, no shorts or revealing clothes). Wearing black is recommended to blend in behind the scenes.
  • Be on Time: Arrive at least 1 hour before your scheduled serving time. Inform your ministry coordinator immediately if you’ll be late or if an emergency arises.
  • Communicate Absences Clearly: If unable to serve, arrange for a teammate to cover your responsibilities, brief them properly, and promptly notify your team leader by chat, text, or call.
  • Embrace Feedback: Regularly evaluate your service and openly receive constructive feedback to help our team continuously improve.
  • Honor Confidentiality: Respect the confidentiality of church materials and honor copyright guidelines.

docs.title: Video Camera Operators (Main & Moving)
docs.text: Operate cameras to provide clear livestream coverage—wide shots for capturing the whole stage, and moving (tight) shots to follow speakers or pastors closely as they move.

docs.title: Critical Shortcuts (These are examples only)
docs.text:
• Start/Stop Stream: Ctrl+Alt+S
  • Switch Scenes: Number Keys 1-6
  • Toggle Audio Mute: M (per source selection)
  • Studio Mode Transition: Ctrl+T

docs.title: Streaming Best Practices (These are examples only)
docs.text:
1. Pre-Stream Setup
  2. Test internet speed (minimum 10Mbps upload)

  3. Create dedicated scenes for:

    • Worship (lower-third lyrics overlay)
    • Sermon (full-screen speaker)
    • Announcements (graphics template)

  4. Audio Management

  5. Set compressor on vocal channels (-10dB threshold)
  6. Maintain -6dB headroom on master mix

  7. Route Zoom audio through virtual cable

  8. Recording Backups

  9. Record locally while streaming
  10. Use MKV format to prevent file corruption
  11. File naming: Stream_YYYY-MM-DD_HHMM.mkv

docs.title: ProPresenter Operations Guide
docs.text: ProPresenter is the central presentation software used to display song lyrics, call to worship scriptures, videos, and other visual media during services and events.

docs.title: Essential Keyboard Shortcuts in Presentation Mode
docs.text:
• Slide Advance: Right Arrow
  • Previous Slide: Left Arrow
  • Clear Slide: F2
  • Clear Media: F3
  • For more shortcuts, visit Propresenter Keyboard Shortcuts

docs.title: Pre-Service Checklist
docs.text:
• Arrive 1 hour early before the service to give plenty of time for preparation.
  • Turn on the computers, big screens and stage display.
  • Launch Propresenter.
    • Add the song lyrics in the playlist (e.g. Sunday Service).
    • Scan the lyrics and catch any typos and formatting issues.
    • Ensure song lyrics are in the middle of the screen for AM service, and lower-thirds for PM service.
    • Choose appropriate background for each song.
  • Open the Sermon Keynote
    • Request the sermon keynote from Stage management team if not yet provided.
    • Preview the keynote to be familiar with the content.
    • Ensure readability and catch typos.
  • Verify that output is displaying correctly on all screens (e.g. Big screens and stage displays).
  • Coordinate with the Stage management team if a clicker will be used by the Pastor.

docs.title: Camera Bodies
docs.text:
Cameras with IBIS (In-Body Image Stabilization), preferably Full Frame sensors:

  • Sony a7 III/IV (Full Frame)
  • Sony a6600/a6700 (APS-C)

docs.title: Lenses
docs.text:
Zoom lenses with OIS (Optical Image Stabilization), for example:

  • Tamron 70-180mm f/2.8 Di III VC VXD G2
  • Tamron 50-300mm f/4.5-6.3 Di III VC VXD
  • Sony FE 70-200mm f/4 G OSS II

docs.title: Exposure Configuration
docs.text:
• Frame Rate: 30p
  • Shutter Speed: 1/60s
  • Largest Aperture: f/4.0 - f/5.6 (to prevent focus breathing)
  • Maximum ISO: 1000

docs.title: Stabilization
docs.text:
• Enable in-body stabilization (IBIS) when available
  • Activate lens OIS when available
  • Use tripod/monopod for static shots

docs.title: Composition Guidelines
docs.text:
1. Rule of Thirds: Position subjects at intersection points
  2. Stage Coverage:
  3. Wide shots: Capture entire stage during group performances
  4. Tight shots: Focus on lead vocalist/soloists (face + upper torso)
  5. Focus Settings:
  6. Mode: Continuous AF
  7. Area: Zone (Top-Center)
  8. Subject Detection, when available: Human

docs.title: Pre-Event Setup
docs.text:
• Arrive 60 minutes before service
  • Use dummy battery to connect to a continuous power source
  • Mount camera on stabilized platform
  • Coordinate with stage director to set expected shots
  • Practice aperture and ISO adjustments
  • Enable Zebra pattern to indicate areas of a frame that are close to overexposure
  • Display Histogram

docs.title: During Event
docs.text:
• Be ready for adjustments and correction from stage director
  • Maintain exposure consistency by watching histogram
  • Check focus before critical moments

docs.title: Post-Event
docs.text:
• Disassemble and pack the camera and lens neatly
  • Report any technical issues
